fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Consumers, Customs, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Business and Industry, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Research and innovation, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives:
SAS has an interest in a wide range of EU policies and legislation given the breadth of the SAS offering across several industries. In no particular order and non-exhaustively, these are some of the main EU policies and files covered in 2017: 
-Data Protection and Privacy 
-Intellectual Property Rights 
-Big data 
-Free flow of data 
-Artificial intelligence & machine learning 
-The Internet of Things 
-Customs and Trade 
-Digital Economy 
-Digital Single Market
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
source: European Commission, Council of Europe, EUROSTAT, JRC, ECB, EFSA, EIB, EIF, FRONTEX, EPO, EORTC, EFA, ECC AG, EURO BANK S.A.
membership:
-American Chamber of Commerce to the EU 
-British Chamber of Commerce in Belgium 
-DIGITALEUROPE 
-Business Software Alliance (BSA)
position: Director EU Public Policy & Legal Counsel
goals__remit: Founded in 1976, SAS is the leader in analytics. Through innovative analytics, business intelligence and data management software and services, SAS helps customers make better decisions faster. SAS has customers in 149 countries. Our software is installed at more than 83,000 business, government and university sites.
